perturbation.original_text:
All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment
to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text:
All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment
to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL. Notwithstanding the foregoing, VAL shall have the option to extend the payment deadline to 30 days post-completion, subject to a 2% deduction from the total payment amount due to administrative overhead.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment deadline. The original clause states payment within 7 days, but the modified clause introduces an option for VAL to extend the deadline to 30 days with a penalty. This creates uncertainty about the actual payment terms and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement will be for the maximum period of six (6) months beginning for the commencement
date, renewable in accordance with the terms hereof, unless earlier terminated pursuant to this
Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement will be for the maximum period of six (6) months beginning for the commencement
date, renewable in accordance with the terms hereof, unless earlier terminated pursuant to this
Agreement. However, upon mutual written agreement, the parties may extend the term indefinitely without formal renewal, subject to satisfactory performance reviews conducted bi-annually.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction about the agreement period. The original clause defines a maximum period of six months, but the modification introduces the possibility of indefinite extension, which conflicts with the initial term limitation. This creates uncertainty and potential disputes about the actual duration of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If
the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of
termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed.
In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work
done till date to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text:
VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing. If
the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of
termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing to VAL. Notwithstanding the previous sentence, Developer can terminate this agreement at anytime, even after completion of the project, without any repercussions. 
In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work
done till date to VAL.
perturbation.explanation: The original text limits termination to when the project is not completed but in modified text, the developer can terminate the agreement at anytime without any penalty even after the completion of the project. Thus, creating a conflict.
